faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs beyond the property price include: transfer tax (6-8% depending on region), notary fees (€500-1,500), property registration (€300-800), legal representation (typically €1,000-2,000), and valuation reports if mortgaged. Total acquisition costs typically range 8-12% of purchase price. Annual ownership costs include property tax (IBI, approximately 0.4-1.1% of property value), community fees if applicable (€50-200 monthly), and insurance (€300-600 annually). These costs are predictable and transparent compared to many other European markets.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes, numerous Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-residents, typically covering 70-80% of property value at competitive interest rates. Santander, BBVA, and CaixaBank maintain established foreign lending programs. Requirements include proof of income (employment contracts, tax returns), personal identification, and property appraisal. Processing typically requires 4-6 weeks. Mortgage rates currently operate around 3-4% for 20-30 year terms, substantially lower than UK/US comparable rates. Your legal representative coordinates mortgage documentation alongside property transaction processes.

faqs.question: What is the weather like in Cartagena, Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean climate delivers 300+ annual sunshine days with mild winters (average 12°C, rarely freezing) and warm summers (average 28°C). Annual rainfall totals approximately 300mm, concentrated in autumn/spring, with dry conditions throughout summer. Sea temperature ranges 12-28°C seasonally, comfortable for swimming June-October. This climate pattern supports year-round usage and guest visitation, maximizing holiday rental season flexibility compared to more seasonal northern European markets.
